verses.name: Acts 26:5
verses.text: Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

verses.name: Acts 26:6
verses.text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:

verses.name: Acts 26:7
verses.text: Unto which promise our twelve tribes, instantly serving God day and night, hope to come. For which hope’s sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.

verses.name: Acts 26:8
verses.text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?
